leech_grid_properties.description: Leech lattice: optimal 24D packing with unique 196560-contact geometry

leech_shell_distances.description: Radii of successive shells (squared distances from origin, in units of 2)

physical_interpretation.shell_structure: Leech lattice represents quantized depth of 24D manifold visibility at different observation scales
physical_interpretation.r_cell_quantization: Observable scale k corresponds to specific shell layer(s) of Leech structure
physical_interpretation.cosmological_connection: Different cosmological surveys probe different shell layers due to mass/bias evolution
physical_interpretation.mathematical_basis: Unique properties of Leech lattice (optimal packing, 24 generators) naturally encode cosmic structure

survey_shell_mapping.description: Hypothesized Leech shell assignments for different cosmological surveys

DES.notes: Large-scale structure surveys probe outer shells

KiDS.notes: Small-scale weak lensing surveys probe inner shells

Planck.notes: CMB probes different epoch and shell layers

quantization_method.approach: Linear combination of Leech shell magnitudes
constraints: All shell distances derived from Leech geometry (no free parameters)
Linear combination coefficients (a) optimized via LOO-CV only within survey
Overall scale R_0 fixed from physical theory or prior measurements
quantization_method.degrees_of_freedom: Minimal - only shell selection + single mixing coefficient per survey

ssot_status.hardcoded_values: None - all Leech shell distances from mathematical definition
